com.blongho.country_data

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blongho.country_data.World

  • public final class World
extends Object
    Since:
    March 2019

    The World knows all the countries and their name, alpha2, alpha3, numeric code and flag.
    If a country does not exist or is at least not formally recognized, that country will be
    represented as Earth with flag that of the globe
    Author:
    Bernard Che Longho (blongho02@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(Context ctx)
        Initialize the world, just as it is today with all its countries and flags
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context where this object is called (getAppicationContext)

        Call this once to initialize the data

      • getFlagOf

        public static int getFlagOf(int countryCode)
        Get the flag of a country using the numeric code of the country

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get image of globe

        Parameters:
        countryCode - The numeric code of the country
        Returns:
        An image resource representing the country flag or the image of the globe

      • getFlagOf

        public static int getFlagOf(@NotNull
                            String countryIdentifier)
        Get the flag of a country

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get image of globe

        Parameters:
        countryIdentifier - the 2 or 3 letter representation of the country
        e.g {se|SE|SWE|swe} are all valid entries for a Swedish flag
        Returns:
        the id of the flag resource or id of globe image if the
        iso alpha2 or iso alpha3 is not correct or if there is no
        entry in the flag container with that identify.

        Note: If the values are correct and you still do not get the flag, create an issue and this will be resolved as soon as possible.

      • getWorldFlag

        public static int getWorldFlag()
        Get the image of the globe directly rather than querying World.getFlagOf("globe")

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get image of globe

        Returns:
        The image of the globe as we know it today

      • getCountryFrom

        public static Country getCountryFrom(int numericCode)
        Get a country from its numeric code

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get a country called Earth

        Parameters:
        numericCode - The country's numeric code
        Returns:
        A country a country with any of the attributes or a Earth

      • getCountryFrom

        public static Country getCountryFrom(String countryIdentifier)
        Get a country from any of its identifiers

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get a country called Earth

        Parameters:
        countryIdentifier - The country name, alpha2 or alpha3 values, case insensitive
        Returns:
        A country a country with any of the attributes or a Earth

      • getAllCountries

        public static List<Country> getAllCountries()
        Get an immutable list of all the countries with their flags

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get an empty list

        Returns:
        List of all the countries.
        Attempting to modify this list invokes an exception and your app will crash.

      • getAllCurrencies

        public static List<Currency> getAllCurrencies()
        Return all the currencies of the world

        Pre-condition:
        init(Context) must have been called, otherwise you get an empty list

        Returns:
        The currencies of the world {alpha2, curencyName, currencyCode, currencySymbol}
